data:
Facsimile Images

ἐνθάδε κῖτε
Παῦλα ζήσασ<α>
ἔτη κε´ ἀνέλυσε
δὲ τὸν βίον πρὸ η´ καλα[ν-]
5δῶν Δεκενβρίων ὑπατίᾳ
Ἱερίου καὶ Ἀρταβουρίου τῶν̣
λανπροτάτων

Apparatus criticus

The text is lightly engraved, and Kaibel's text is based upon a cursory autopsy by Mommsen ('Descripsit festinans, ut ipse ait, Mommsen'); and many of the corrections gaps or other omissions in Kaibel's text are in fact not a true reflection of what is on the stone (see already the better, but previously unpublished, reading of Orsi). ; Kaibel: ΖΗΙΑΣ; Orsi: ΖΗΓΑΕ.
line.3: Kaibel: ΛΝΕΛΙΙ; Orsi: ΑΝΕΑΥΤΕ
line.4: Kaibel: bΙΟΝ; Kaibel: ΚΑΛ////
line.5: Kaibel: ·Τ//ΠΑ
line.6: Kaibel: ΑΡΙΟ\ΙΟΥΡΙΤΗ////; Orsi: ΑΡΤΑΛΟΥΡΙΟΥ; Ferrua: ΑΡΤΑΒΟΥΡΙΟΥ
line.7: Orsi: ΑΜΠΡΟΤΑΤΩΝ

English translation

Here lies Paula, having lived 25 years, she lost her life 8 days before the kalends of December (24 November), in the consulship of the illustrious Hierios and Artabourios

commentary

The text was also seen and transcribed by Orsi in the first of his Taccuini, in later 1888. Ferrua already correctly read the name of the consul of 427 CE in line 6 (PLRE II, Ardabur 3), observing that the variant in Arta- is well attested (for Latin Ardabur, Greek Ἀρδαβούριος).

bibliography

  • 14.0159 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • 36.0875 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796
  • 675 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000394
  • Orsi 2018 Tacc. 1, p. 78 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002617
  • Ferrua 1982-1983 18 no.57 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001996
